com.ikalagaming.core.packages

Interface IPlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Package
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Plugin

    public interface IPlugin
extends Package
    An interface that extends the package interface. Contains methods for handling descriptions and configuration of plugins.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.ikalagaming.core.packages.Package

        version

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FileConfiguration getConfig()
      Returns the FileConfiguration for the plugin.
      PluginDescription getDescription()
      Returns a PluginDescription for the plugin.
      void reloadConfig()
      Clears out the configuration in memory and reloads it from the disk.
      void saveConfig()
      Saves the configuration to disk.
      void saveDefaultConfig()
      Saves the default configuration.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.ikalagaming.core.packages.Package

        disable, enable, getName, getPackageManager, getVersion, isEnabled, onDisable, onEnable, onLoad, onUnload, reload, setPackageManager

    • Method Detail

      • getDescription

        PluginDescription getDescription()
        Returns a PluginDescription for the plugin.
        Returns:
        the description for the plugin

      • getConfig

        FileConfiguration getConfig()
        Returns the FileConfiguration for the plugin.
        Returns:
        the FileConfiguration for the plugin

      • saveConfig

        void saveConfig()
        Saves the configuration to disk. Any changes made in memory will overwrite the file on disk.

      • saveDefaultConfig

        void saveDefaultConfig()
        Saves the default configuration. If a configuration already exists on disk, nothing happens. If no default configuration file is in contained in the plugin, an empty configuration file is saved.

      • reloadConfig

        void reloadConfig()
        Clears out the configuration in memory and reloads it from the disk.
